trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Cranbrook
There were no other sightings in Cranbrook on or around May 5th 2006
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting Details I actually think this is a flying bug that went by my lense. But is does look interesting. When I took this photo I only seen the bird. but I do remember lots of bugs flying around, so that is what I figure it was. And possably many photo's are the same if I'm right. I shot this with a Panasonic DMC-FZ30 Focal length 43.3mm. I know this for fact because I looked up the details in the photo today to find the proper date and it also had some other info in the photo. Although I do believe in UFO's I really don't think this is more then a fly or something in that nature. But back in 1978 or 79 my exwife and I seen an incredible amount of flying lights of Crows nest lake in Alberta Canada. I was going to pull over and have a look but my exwife reached over with her foot and laid on the gas. This took place at about 2am I believe it was the fall of 78 or spring of 79. I son't quit remember. But our son was under a year old and we traveled to Alberta to see a eye specialist for him. I have always wondered what we seen. There were hunderds of light flooting in the sky made it look like it was just about daytime. This is why I do believe but never was able to see a shape of what I saw so how knows. But I truly believe the object in the bird photo is nothing more then a bug flying by. I actually named this photo UFO. And I posted it on Rendersity under the user name michif. I also said in that posting that I believe it to be a bug flying by. My time zone is mountain time, was'nt to sure of the of the abrv. on that
